snippet: The garment district, even after the last fabric store has closed shop, should keep its name and inspire New Yorkers for years to come.
abstract: Op-Ed article by jewelry historian Jean Appleton argues against New York City changing the name of the garment district, once-bustling epicenter of America's clothing industry that now employs far fewer workers; fears changing the area's name would erase a vital part of New York's past.
lead_paragraph: The garment district, even after the last fabric store has closed shop, should keep its name and inspire New Yorkers for years to come.
